remarks: Define the class of measurable functions on the reals.  A real function is measurable if the preimage of every open interval is a measurable set (see ~ ismbl ) and a complex function is measurable if the real and imaginary parts of the function is measurable.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jun-2014.)
